Questions.Question: Who was the King of England during the signing of the Magna Carta?
Questions.Explanation: King John was the reigning monarch of England when the Magna Carta was signed in 1215.

Questions.Question: Which city was the capital of the Holy Roman Empire?
Questions.Explanation: Aachen, located in modern-day Germany, served as the capital of the Holy Roman Empire under Charlemagne.

Questions.Question: Who was the first King of the Franks?
Questions.Explanation: Clovis, also known as Clovis I, was the first King of the Franks and founder of the Merovingian dynasty.

Questions.Question: Which battle marked the end of the Viking Age?
Questions.Explanation: The Battle of Stamford Bridge in 1066 is considered the final event of the Viking Age.

Questions.Question: Who was the author of 'The Canterbury Tales'?
Questions.Explanation: Geoffrey Chaucer, an English poet, wrote 'The Canterbury Tales' in the late 14th century.

Questions.Question: Which Pope called for the First Crusade?
Questions.Explanation: Pope Urban II issued the call for the First Crusade during the Council of Clermont in 1095.

Questions.Question: Who was the last Anglo-Saxon King of England?
Questions.Explanation: Harold II, also known as Harold Godwinson, was the last Anglo-Saxon King of England before the Norman Conquest.

Questions.Question: Which medieval scholar is known for his work 'Summa Theologica'?
Questions.Explanation: Thomas Aquinas, an Italian Dominican friar, is renowned for his philosophical and theological masterpiece 'Summa Theologica.'

Questions.Question: Which city was the center of the Byzantine Empire?
Questions.Explanation: Constantinople, now Istanbul, was the capital and cultural hub of the Byzantine Empire.

Questions.Question: Who was the first Holy Roman Emperor?
Questions.Explanation: Charlemagne, also known as Charles the Great, was crowned the first Holy Roman Emperor in 800.

Questions.Question: Which medieval English king was known as 'The Lionheart'?
Questions.Explanation: Richard I, also called Richard the Lionheart, was a renowned warrior king of England during the late 12th century.

Questions.Question: Who was the founder of the Knights Templar?
Questions.Explanation: Hugues de Payens, a French knight, was one of the founding members of the Knights Templar in the early 12th century.

Questions.Question: Which medieval queen was known as 'Eleanor of Aquitaine'?
Questions.Explanation: Eleanor of Aquitaine was a powerful queen consort of France and England during the 12th century.

Questions.Question: Which medieval English king signed the Magna Carta?
Questions.Explanation: King John of England reluctantly signed the Magna Carta in 1215, limiting royal power.

Questions.Question: Who was the leader of the Mongol Empire during the 13th century?
Questions.Explanation: Genghis Khan, born Temujin, founded and led the Mongol Empire, one of the largest empires in history.

Questions.Question: Which medieval English king was known as 'The Confessor'?
Questions.Explanation: Edward the Confessor, the last Anglo-Saxon king of England before the Norman Conquest, was known for his piety.

Questions.Question: Which medieval English king was responsible for the Domesday Book?
Questions.Explanation: William the Conqueror commissioned the Domesday Book, a comprehensive survey of England's land and resources.

Questions.Question: Who was the leader of the English army during the Battle of Agincourt?
Questions.Explanation: King Henry V of England led the English army to a decisive victory in the Battle of Agincourt during the Hundred Years' War.

Questions.Question: Which medieval English king was known as 'The Black Prince'?
Questions.Explanation: Edward, Prince of Wales, son of Edward III, earned the nickname 'The Black Prince' for his black armor.

Questions.Question: Who was the first King of England from the House of Tudor?
Questions.Explanation: Henry VII became the first monarch of the House of Tudor after winning the Wars of the Roses.
